content: [alette] "He told me how he and Onef are kin. Ekkill had a sister who married Onef, but she died a long time ago. They've been bound since, but then Onef left without him. Just left him behind without a word. That's why he came after us."

content.option: "I don't care what he says, stay away."

content: [alette] "I don't!" says Alette. "I'm not stupid, you know. I don't go alone. I always bring Oddleif with me." She stalks off back to camp. At least with Oddleif there you feel a little better about things.
[alette] "I feel like things are changing so quickly," she eventually confides. "It's not just that. Everything is going so/= wrong=/. I've been talking to Ekkill a lot..." This gets your attention.

[alette] "I know," she says. "That's why I'm talking to him. He won't try to kill us if he likes us. I think he's not the person he seems to be, he just reacts too quickly. When he talks you can tell there's more to him."
[alette] "Where are you going?" asks Alette when you suddenly draw your axe. "Stay here," you reply.

[alette] You haven't seen Alette for much of the day. When you do find her, she's returning to camp alone from a fair distance away, looking rather sullen. She keeps her eyes on the ground as you approach.
[alette] You pat Alette on the head and leave her to her thoughts. She'll come to you when she's ready, you assume.

[onef] Eventually you find Onef back at camp and relate the story. "Is that what Ekkill told you?" replies Onef. Then he sighs. "It's true about his sister, she died of a fever when we were just married. Surprised he opened up like that."
[onef] "I will," says Onef. "But it sounds more like you need to keep Alette away from him." You leave with the advice ringing in your ears.
[onef] "So, I left him in Frostvellr," he continues. "He'd be fine one day, ready to kill his own men the next. Sometimes he would. I'd make the same decision tomorrow."

content.option: Tell Onef to keep him away from Alette

content: [rook] You feel certain Alette got the message. Instead of stirring up more trouble you decide to let the issue drop, and keep a tighter watch on Ekkill.
[rook] You make it clear you don't want Alette going anywhere near Ekkill. You end up bickering with her, but she finally relents, stalking off back to camp.
[rook] You march directly over to where Ekkill has been forced to stay, far away from the rest of the caravan. He turns as you approach.
